Operation 'list-syncs' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context, not_actionable. The original summary and description are overly generic and lack actionable context. The description doesn't explain what data is returned, why an agent would use this operation, or what the company ID parameter represents. The improved version clarifies the operation retrieves sync statuses for a specific company, explains the return value includes sync history and state information, provides context about monitoring sync progress, and explicitly mentions the required company ID parameter. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (monitoring sync status) and what to expect.

data.current_description: Gets a list of sync statuses
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve sync statuses for a company
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all data sync statuses for a specified company. Returns sync status information including sync history, current state, and timestamps. Use this operation to monitor the progress and results of commerce data synchronizations to the accounting software. Requires a valid company ID.
data.reasoning: The original summary and description are overly generic and lack actionable context. The description doesn't explain what data is returned, why an agent would use this operation, or what the company ID parameter represents. The improved version clarifies the operation retrieves sync statuses for a specific company, explains the return value includes sync history and state information, provides context about monitoring sync progress, and explicitly mentions the required company ID parameter. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (monitoring sync status) and what to expect.

message: Operation 'get-sync-flow-url' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original summary was vague about the actual output (URL with passcode). Added specificity about the URL generation, one-time passcode security, and return value for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description: Create a new company and connections. Get a URL for Sync Flow, including a one time passcode.
data.summary_suggestion: Generate Sync Flow URL with one-time passcode
data.description_suggestion: Generates a URL to initiate the Sync Flow for a specified commerce and accounting integration pair. The URL includes a one-time passcode for secure access. This operation creates a new company and establishes initial connections between the commerce source and accounting destination. Returns a URL that can be shared with end users to complete the sync configuration flow.
data.reasoning: Original summary was vague about the actual output (URL with passcode). Description lacked clarity about what the operation returns and the security mechanism. Added specificity about the URL generation, one-time passcode security, and return value for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Creates a connection for the company by providing a valid `platformKey`. 

Use the [List Integrations](https://docs.codat.io/platform-api#/operations/list-integrations) endpoint to access valid platform keys.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new data connection for a company by specifying a valid platform key. The platform key identifies the data source integration (e.g., Shopify, Square, Xero). Use the List Integrations endpoint to retrieve available platform keys and their details. Returns the created connection object with its unique identifier, status, and platform information. The connection can then be authorized to enable data synchronization.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description provided the mechanism (platformKey) but lacked context about what platforms are supported and what the operation returns. Added clarity about platform types, return value, and the next step (authorization) to improve AI agent understanding of the complete workflow.

message: Operation 'request-sync' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary is generic ('new sync' could apply to multiple operations). Description lacks clarity on return value and async behavior. Enhanced summary to specify 'to latest date' for differentiation. Added details about what SyncToLatestArgs contains, return value, and that the operation is asynchronous for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description:
Run a Commerce sync from the last successful sync up to the date provided (optional), otherwise UtcNow is used.
If there was no previously successful sync, the start date in the config is used.
data.summary_suggestion: Initiate Commerce sync to latest date
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a Commerce sync from the last successful sync up to an optional end date (defaults to current UTC time). If no previous successful sync exists, uses the configured start date. Accepts a SyncToLatestArgs object specifying the optional end date. Returns a sync status object indicating the sync has been initiated. The operation queues the sync for processing and returns immediately.
data.reasoning: Summary is generic ('new sync' could apply to multiple operations). Description lacks clarity on return value and async behavior. Enhanced summary to specify 'to latest date' for differentiation. Added details about what SyncToLatestArgs contains, return value, and that the operation is asynchronous for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description: Initiate a sync for the specified start date to the specified finish date in the request payload.
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a Commerce sync for a specified date range by accepting start and finish dates in the SyncRange request payload. Returns a sync status object indicating the sync has been initiated. This operation allows historical data syncing and queues the sync for asynchronous processing. The sync will replicate commerce data within the specified date boundaries.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear but description lacks essential details. Missing: what SyncRange contains, what is returned, async behavior, and the purpose of date-range syncing (historical data). Added specificity about input structure, return value, async nature, and use case context for better AI agent interpretability.
